I’ve been writing a simple AV in python and used the Clamav signature database ( one of few av databases you can come by ). Though it is a bit of a hack grabbing it as you need to remove the first 512 bytes from the file as thats the Clamav signature.

With it removed it’s just a simple .tar.gz file!

I’ve made a python script with support for both download the whole database and update it. Though it may look a bit messy it works flawlessy, if you use it correct ;) Give a comment with error messages if it fails.

  1 #Clamav database fetcher and unpacker.
  2 #Made by Tomasuh/Axel Olsson at tomsonsec.com
  3 #For contact: tomasuh [at] tomsonsec.com
  4 import sys,tarfile,os,shutil,stat,urllib2,random 
  5 class ClamAvDatabase(object):
  6 
  7     wantedFiles = ["main.db","main.fp","main.hdb","main.info","main.mdb","main.ndb","main.zmd"]
  8  
  9     def __init__(self):
 10         if len (sys.argv) != 2:
 11             print "Usage:" + sys.argv[0] + " maindb/update"
 12             sys.exit()
 13  
 14         if sys.argv[1]=="maindb":
 15             self.dlDatabase("http://db.local.clamav.net/main.cvd")
 16             self.cleanup()
 17             self.removeHeader()
 18             self.extractFiles("clamavDB")
 19         elif sys.argv[1]=="update":
 20             self.dlDatabase("http://db.local.clamav.net/daily.cvd")
 21             directoryName = self.tempPath()
 22             self.removeHeader()
 23             self.extractFiles(directoryName)
 24             self.updateFiles(directoryName,"clamavDB/")
 25             self.rmPath(directoryName)
 26             sys.exit()
 27  
 28     #Downloads specified url and saves to test.cv
 29     def dlDatabase(self,url):
 30         self.makeWritable("","test.cvd")
 31         dl = urllib2.urlopen(url)
 32         meta = dl.info()
 33         fileSize = int(meta.getheaders("Content-Length")[0])
 34         fileDataSave=""
 35         print "Downloading database, this might take a minute or two."
 36         #I know this aint memory sufficent for shit, but hey, I hope you can spare 60 MB of RAM.
 37         while True:
 38             fileData = dl.read(8024)
 39             if not fileData:
 40                 break
 41             fileDataSave+=fileData
 42             progress = ((len(fileDataSave)*10/fileSize))
 43             sys.stdout.write ("\r"+"["+"*" * progress + " " * (10 - progress)+ "]")
 44             sys.stdout.flush()
 45         print "\n"
 46         with open("test.cvd","wb") as f:
 47             f.write(fileDataSave)
 48  
 49     #Makes file writable if not.
 50     def makeWritable(self,directory,fileN):
 51         if os.path.isfile(directory+fileN):
 52             if(not os.access(directory+fileN,os.W_OK)):
 53                 os.chmod(directory+fileN, stat.S_IWRITE)
 54  
 55     #Cleanup from last download
 56     def cleanup(self):
 57         if os.access("clamavDB", os.F_OK):
 58             answ = raw_input("Directory clamavDB already exists, remove previous db files to avoid collisions? yes/no/abort\n")
 59             if answ=="yes":
 60                 #Would be so more neat with just a rmtree for
 61                 #the whole clamavDB and recreate the directory,
 62                 #but wth, I want this to look good (and keep unassociated files)
 63                 self.makeWritable("clamavDB","")
 64  
 65                 for fileOrDirectory in os.listdir("clamavDB"):
 66                     #We only need to remove the ones we are gonna replace.
 67                     if fileOrDirectory in self.wantedFiles:
 68                         self.makeWritable("clamavDB/", fileOrDirectory)
 69                         if os.path.isdir("clamavDB/"+fileOrDirectory):
 70                             shutil.rmtree("clamavDB/"+fileOrDirectory,True)
 71                         else:
 72                             os.remove("clamavDB/"+fileOrDirectory)
 73  
 74             elif answ=="no":
 75                 print "Your fault if anything goes wrong but lets do this!"
 76  
 77             else:
 78                 print "Aborting"
 79                 sys.exit()
 80         else:
 81             os.mkdir("clamavDB")
 82  
 83     #Extracts the tar.gz
 84     def extractFiles(self,directory):
 85         extract = tarfile.open("test.cvd", "r:gz")
 86         try:
 87             for files in self.wantedFiles:
 88                 extract.extract(files,directory)
 89         except: # add exact exception
 90             extract.extractall(directory)
 91  
 92         extract.close()
 93         self.makeWritable("","test.cvd")
 94         os.remove("test.cvd")
 95  
 96     #r+b mode dosn't seem to work with binary files, weird.
 97     def removeHeader (self):
 98         with open("test.cvd","rb") as f1:
 99             data = f1.read()[512:]
100         with open("test.cvd", "wb") as f2:
101             f2.write(data)
102  
103     #Fetches the update files with the correct file extension and appends them to the corresponding in the clamavDB directory.
104     #(Observe that the only files who will be updated is the ones in wanted files)
105     def updateFiles(self,inputDirectory,outputDirectory):
106         for files in self.wantedFiles:
107             fileExtension = files.find(".")
108             self.makeWritable(inputDirectory,"daily"+files[fileExtension:])
109             self.makeWritable(outputDirectory,files)
110             with open(inputDirectory+"daily"+files[fileExtension:],"r") as f:
111                 with open(outputDirectory+files,"a") as f2:
112                     f2.write(f.read())
113  
114     #A temporary path for storing the update files for a short time.
115     def tempPath(self):
116         directoryName = str(random.randint(10000,9999999))
117         #print directoryName
118         os.mkdir(directoryName)
119         return str (directoryName+"/")
120  
121     #First we need to make the stuff inside the folder writable, after the folder itself, then we can remove it.
122     def rmPath(self,directory):
123         for files in os.listdir(directory):
124             self.makeWritable(directory, files)
125         self.makeWritable(directory, "")
126         shutil.rmtree(directory,True)
127  
128 test = ClamAvDatabase()
